context.p: The euca-bundle-instance command lets you bundle a new Windows image from a running Windows instance directly to Walrus storage. Using euca-bundle-instance is an efficient way to generate modified Windows VMs. You can spin up a Windows VM instance from an existing Windows VM image, modify it as needed, then save the modified image to Walrus storage, where it is immediately available for registering and running with the modifications already in place.

info.codeblock: euca-bundle-instance -b <storeage_bucket_name> <instance_ID> -p followed by the image prefix; -o followed by the access key id of the user; and –w followed by the secret key id of the user.
info.note: You can query the progress of a euca-bundle-instance command using the describe-bundle-task command. You can cancel the progress of euca-bundle-instance command using cancel-bundle-task command.
